To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.
   

  

 Join us today to build Wolt together.

title: Account Manager
description:
**Who we are** 




 We are Elaway! We exist to accelerate the green transition in Europe, from fossil fuels to electricity. We do so by making the installation and operation of charging facilities for housing communities easy.
 



  





 Elaway Sweden started off in the beginning of 2022 and has been on massive growth journey with the goal of electrifying Sweden. With three locations in Sweden, we have high ambitions for our path forward and want our employees to grow at the same pace as the company⚡.
 



  





 We are a group of 70+ amazing people spread across Europe, all believing that we are here to make a difference. After all, it takes a few people to become Europe’s largest provider of car charging facilities for housing communities.
 



  





**Why join us** 




 If you want to make a difference to the world and contribute to the green shift while having a lot of fun, this is your opportunity! You will work with amazing colleagues across Europe and be a central piece of our growth journey 🚀.
 



  





**We need your help** 




 The share of EV cars is increasing rapidly and so is the need to make charging more accessible. Therefore, we are looking for a new team member to join our active sales team as an Account Manager in Stockholm to lead the entire sales process from cold-calling and lead generation to closing deals.
 



  





**This is your role** 




 You are part of our active sales team and have a very particular set of skills that you have acquired over the years working within sales. You are a subtle hunter that truly loves to run fast, but you also know when it's time to take a step back and listen to your client.
 



  





 You are responsible for the whole sales process including everything from actively reaching out to new prospects, book and conduct site visits/Sales meetings to follow-up meetings, sending out offers and closing the sales process.
 



  





**Who are you** 




 We believe that you have 3-5 years of experience within sales, particularly within outbound sales. Additionally, you have experience in working with CRM-systems. You are excited to meet and talk to new people and feel comfortable to actively reach out to prospects.
 



  





 In terms of languages, you are fluent in both Swedish and English, verbally and written. Since most of our customers in Sweden prefer communicating in Swedish, it is essential that you feel comfortable leading the sales process completely in Swedish.
 



 Since this role involves site visits with clients, having a driver's license is necessary.
 



  





**We love our values - and so should you** 




 A cultural fit is crucial to thrive at Elaway. That's why we need to ensure that you can relate to our values:
 



  





 🚘
 **Drivers first** 
 – O
 *ur customers, the drivers using our chargers, always come first* 




 🎯
 **Focused execution** 
 –
 *We make bold choices, prioritizing what truly matters* 




 and last but not least;
 



 💖
 **Empowered by People** 
 –
 *Together, we are building a better tomorrow* 




  





 If you can relate to these and love them as much as we do, then we might possibly be a perfect match!
 



 We truly do hope that we are just what you're looking for, and if so we would love to hear from you.
 



  





*Please note that our company language is English – therefore, we ask you to send your application in English.*

title: Courier Stockholm area
description:
We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team of Couriers.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 FedEx is the largest express transportation company in the world, connecting more than 220 countries and territories. We work every moment to deliver the most important package of someone’s day. Our team of passionate people know their day-to-day work is invaluable in delivering outstanding experience to our customers. 530,000 team members strong, we are as diverse as the world we serve. We love what we do, and we do it well. Our reach is big, and so are our dreams. Join us and let's write our next chapter together.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Representing FedEx in front of our customers, courteously picking up and delivering their packages
* Driving vehicles in FedEx fleet on defined routes in various postcodes, making sure customers’ packages get to the right place, on time
* Making sure vehicles are always operated safely and legally
* Following all FedEx Health and Safety and other company policies and procedures


**What Do You Bring With You**
* Be a reliable team player
* Be energetic and enthusiastic
* Have a strong customer focus
* Have good communication skills
* Have an eye for detail to make sure paperwork is correct
* Holding a valid driving license for type of vehicle assigned is essential and held for 2+ years would be an advantage.
* Adaptability to external driving conditions and circumstances is required
* Commercial driving experience would be an advantage
* Basic geographical knowledge


**What Do We Offer**
* Attractive compensation package
* Training to get you started and on-the-job learning opportunities
* Extensive learning resources to further develop your skills and knowledge
* Tuition Assistance Program (\*applicable for FedEx positions with a permanent contract)
* Employee Assistance Program for you and your family in difficult life situations
* Employee reduced-rate shipping
* Great career opportunities
* FedEx is one of the worlds most admired companies and trusted brands year after year


 Bring your ideas, individuality, and dreams to our global community. Feel good about where you work. Choose your career path - we’re ready to invest in your development. Join FedEx.
   

  

 FedEx was built on a philosophy that puts people first, one we take seriously. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce in which we provide growth opportunities for all
   

  

 Our Company
   

  

 FedEx is one of the world's largest express transportation companies and has consistently been selected as one of the top 10 World’s Most Admired Companies by "Fortune" magazine. Every day FedEx delivers for its customers with transportation and business solutions, serving more than 220 countries and territories around the globe. We can serve this global network due to our outstanding team of FedEx team members, who are tasked with making every FedEx experience outstanding.
   

  

 Our Philosophy
   

  

 The People-Service-Profit philosophy (P-S-P) describes the principles that govern every FedEx decision, policy or activity. FedEx takes care of our people; they, in turn, deliver the impeccable service demanded by our customers, who reward us with the profitability necessary to secure our future. The essential element in making the People-Service-Profit philosophy such a positive force for the company is where we close the circle, and return these profits back into the business, and invest back in our people. Our success in the industry is attributed to our people. Through our P-S-P philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages team members to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. We care for their well-being, and value their contributions to the company.
   

  

 Our Culture
   

  

 Our culture is important for many reasons, and we intentionally bring it to life through our behaviors, actions and activities in every part of the world. The FedEx culture and values have been a cornerstone of our success and growth since we began in the early 1970’s. While other companies can copy our systems, infrastructure and processes, our culture makes us unique and is often a differentiating factor as we compete and grow in today’s global marketplace.

title: Farm Management Specialist
description:
**Farm Management Specialist, BA system in Product Area Animal Intelligence Solutions**
**Purpose & Mission of role**
 BA (Behaviour Analysis) system is our new innovative solution to support farmers to improve their reproduction, animal health and feeding management and in addition to reduce workload.
   

  

 As Farm Management Specialist you will have a key role in supporting the BA system which is part of our PLA (Product Leadership Area).
   

  

 You will work closely with colleagues in our markets to make sure we provide our customers with support helping them to get the most value of our solutions and thereby improve reproduction, animal health and feeding management and sustainability. You will work closely with colleagues in other entities including our engineering department, Product Management and Development teams, Digital Services teams, Market Area and Cluster advisory teams, as well as external partners.
   

  

 The area of responsibility will focus on the BA system where we are in a growth phase and support is crucial.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Support our markets within areas of biology and herd management with focus on our BA (Behaviour Analysis) system
* Work close with advisory teams in Clusters and Market Areas, developing tools to secure a good support to our end customers
* Create training material and guidelines and performs trainings for Cluster and MA colleagues
* Work close with departments in R&D – to secure quality and performance as well requirments
* Support Digital Service solutions linked to the product area
* Communicate across functions and markets
* Collaborate with external partners related to the products and applications


**Qualifications And Experience**
* University degree within animal husbandry.
* Work experience in agriculture.
* Practical experience from farm management and advisory roles.
* Fluent in English.
* Driver’s license.


 Working with people and support, we value personal skills that help you thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment. You have strong communication and teaching skills and enjoy working across functions, markets, and cultures. You bring structure and drive to your work, collaborating effectively in cross-functional teams. Creating training materials and guidelines comes naturally to you, and you deliver clear and engaging training sessions to colleagues and external partners.
   

  

**Working at DeLaval**
 Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviour. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours: Set Direction, Make Things Happen and One DeLaval.
   

  

 We offer you a workplace like no other, where state-of-the-art technology goes hand in hand with animal welfare. DeLaval is a part of the Tetra Laval Group together with Tetra Pak and Sidel.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time permanent position based at DeLaval’s headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm. The position will be part of the Animal Intelligence Team and will report to Product Area Director Animal Intelligence Solutions. Travelling will be part of the role. We offer a hybrid workplace.
   

  

 We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us.
   

  

**Contact**
 Hiring Manager: Henrik Rosenberg, henrik.rosenberg@delaval.com
   

  

 Recruiter: Mathias Gunnstedt, mathias.gunnstedt@delaval.com
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.
   

  

 See more at corporate.delaval.com

title: SDR Team Lead
description:
**Who we are** 




 We are Elaway! We exist to accelerate the green transition in Europe, from fossil fuels to electricity. We do so by making the installation and operation of charging facilities for housing communities easy.
 



  





 Elaway Sweden started off in the beginning of 2022 and has been on massive growth journey with the goal of electrifying Sweden. With three locations in Sweden, we have high ambitions for our path forward and want our employees to grow at the same pace as the company⚡.
 



  





 We are a group of 70+ amazing people spread across Europe, all believing that we are here to make a difference. After all, it takes a few people to become Europe’s largest provider of car charging facilities for housing communities.
 



  





**Why join us** 




 If you want to make a difference to the world and contribute to the green shift while having a lot of fun, this is your opportunity! You will work with amazing colleagues across Europe and be a central piece of our growth journey 🚀.
 



  





**We need your help** 




 The share of EV cars is increasing rapidly and so is the need to make charging more accessible. Therefore, we are looking for a new team member to join our active sales team as a Sales Development Representative Team Lead to support us in generating leads and building a solid sales funnel as well as to lead our SDR team.
 



  





**This is your role** 




 You are part of our active sales team and work actively together with the team to build a strong sales funnel. You’ll actively reach out to new clients, follow up on leads, and expand your knowledge of sales and charging stations every day. In addition, you will lead and mentor our SDR team, tracking their progress, coaching them to reach their goals, and ensuring strong team performance.
 



  





 Your role consists of two parts - Leading the SDR team while still working operationally as an SDR. You will be identifying new business opportunities, setting up meetings with potential clients, and balancing your own targets with the needs of the team. By leading and empowering the SDR team, you’ll help us find future customers, strengthen our sales efforts, and contribute to Elaway’s growth journey. And of course, we also provide you with the opportunity to grow within the role and within Elaway.
 



  





**Who are you** 




 We believe you have at least 1–2 years of experience in sales, particularly in phone-based sales from previous SDR roles. While prior leadership experience isn’t required, a proactive mindset toward growth and leadership development is essential. You love selling and meeting new people, spotting sales opportunities wherever you go while bringing the right energy to the table. You are eager to learn, target-oriented, and always ready to take on new challenges.
 



  





 In terms of languages, you need to be fluent in English and Swedish (verbal and written) – additional languages and cross-cultural experience are a plus. If you have previous experience in CRM systems that would be an extra perk.
 



  





**We love our values - and so should you** 




 A cultural fit is crucial to thrive at Elaway. That's why we need to ensure that you can relate to our values:
 



 🚘
 **Drivers first** 
 – O
 *ur customers, the drivers using our chargers, always come first* 




 🎯
 **Focused execution** 
 –
 *We make bold choices, prioritizing what truly matters* 




 and last but not least;
 



 💖
 **Empowered by People** 
 –
 *Together, we are building a better tomorrow* 




  





 If you can relate to these and love them as much as we do, then we might possibly be a perfect match!
 



 We truly do hope that we are just what you're looking for, and if so we would love to hear from you.

title: Global Graduate Program - Commercial track
company_industry: Food and Beverage Manufacturing, Manufacturing, and Food and Beverage Services
description:
The Global Graduate Program: 2 years that will shape your entire career. We have graduate positions for the Commercial track within Sales and Marketing open in the UK, Sweden, Norway, Estonia, Poland and Romania.
   

  

 Joining the Unibake Global Graduate Program marks the beginning of an exciting two-year journey filled with professional and personal experiences, growth, and opportunities. This program is thoughtfully designed to develop your functional commercial skills in a business environment while providing leadership challenges that prepare you for an impactful career.
   

  

 We seek the brightest talents, and in exchange, we are committed to guiding you toward a meaningful full-time role where you can make a difference. You'll play a vital part in our mission: "Towards billions of smiling tummies."
   

  

**Why join Unibake and our Global Graduate Program?**
 With over 30 large-scale bakeries across 20+ countries and sales in more than 60 markets worldwide, we are proud to be the second-largest bakery group in Europe. As a global leader in bake-off and fresh bakery products, we serve food retail and food service channels with a strong focus on quality and swift delivery. Our dedication to excellence has made us a trusted partner to some of the world’s largest food providers.
   

  

 Sustainability is not just a "buzz” word for us. We recently committed to the Science Based Targets initiative as part of our ‘Baking for a better World’ sustainability strategy. We are dedicated to ensuring the future of the planet and taking the necessary steps to reduce our carbon footprint, as well as providing healthier product choices, and finally to create better opportunities for people.
   

  

**What to expect from the Commercial track?**
 During the two-year program, you will undertake one-year rotations across various commercial functions such as sales, category management or marketing, gaining valuable experience and taking full responsibility for a range of tasks from day one!
   

  

 You will have the opportunity to contribute to delivering sales and profitable growth targets by driving and supporting marketing and commercial initiatives. Your responsibilities may include developing a deep understanding of customers and consumers to create and execute strategic initiatives that drive growth.
   

  

 You might also work with the Sales department, analyzing data to generate insights and providing recommendations to improve business activities.
   

  

 This Graduate Program offers a broad exposure to various commercial functional areas across different markets, empowering you to explore opportunities and kick-start your career with confidence.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**What will be your Graduate Program highlights?**
**International Two-year program** 
**:** 
 starting in your home country 1st year with an international rotation in your 2nd year will enable you to leave your global footprint in Unibake and build a strong network. After rotation, you will bring experience back to your home country or a new location and continue your career journey there.
   

  

**Career Development Plan** 
**:** 
 Individual development plan that will help to accelerate your career and prepare you for your future with us. Leader or an expert? It’s up to you – you're in the driver’s seat.
   

  

**Support Program and Network** 
**:** 
 A network of dedicated stakeholders will support and guide you throughout your journey, fostering both your personal and professional growth. Additionally, you'll become part of a vibrant community of Global Graduates across various tracks, as well as alumni, providing you with a strong network that spans the entire organization.
   

  

**Expertise to succeed in Commercial and beyond:** 
 You will learn from the best and be exposed to Marketing, Sales or Category Management areas to increase your knowledge and build relevant competencies. In addition, you will take part in quarterly global workshops with your fellow graduates with whom you will also do an international project focused on solving a global challenge.
   

  

**What You Need To Have**
* Fluent in Swedish (or any other Scandinavian languages) and English, with professional working proficiency in both languages.
* A truly international mindset, you must have lived abroad already, and you have the willingness to move geographically, both during and after the Graduate Program.
* A Master’s degree at above pass-rate (or a projection that you’ll achieve this), within Business Administration, Business Development, International Sales, Marketing or other relevant areas.
* Graduation within the last 2 years or expected graduation date before September 2025.
* Availability to start the program full time in September 2025.
* You must be living and able to work in the country where you are applying.
* A personality that fits our values. You are open, have drive, are a curious learner, and see the bigger picture. A person ready to go the extra mile in the pursuit of an ambitious and rewarding career.
* Some relevant work or internship experience from a professional company will be an advantage.


**Sounds interesting?**
 Please apply through our recruitment system and make sure to add the following information:
   

  

* Make sure that you upload your resume, grade transcript and diploma in the application form.
* No cover letter is needed, just answer 3 questions in the application form and tell us more about you and your motivation to join the program.


 We will interview on an ongoing basis so please don’t hesitate to send your application. Your application must be completed in English and will be treated confidentially.
   

  

 If you are a more experienced candidate, you are very welcome to apply to other roles at Lantmännen Unibake via our careers page.

title: Sales Development Representative
company_industry: Renewable Energy Power Generation and Services for Renewable Energy
description:
**Who we are** 




 We are Elaway! We exist to accelerate the green transition in Europe, from fossil fuels to electricity. We do so by making the installation and operation of charging facilities for housing communities easy.
 



  





 Elaway Sweden started off in the beginning of 2022 and has been on massive growth journey with the goal of electrifying Sweden. With three locations in Sweden, we have high ambitions for our path forward and want our employees to grow at the same pace as the company⚡.
 



  





 We are a group of 70+ amazing people spread across Europe, all believing that we are here to make a difference. After all, it takes a few people to become Europe’s largest provider of car charging facilities for housing communities.
 



  





**Why join us** 




 If you want to make a difference to the world and contribute to the green shift while having a lot of fun, this is your opportunity! You will work with amazing colleagues across Europe and be a central piece of our growth journey 🚀.
 



  





**We need your help** 




 The share of EV cars is increasing rapidly and so is the need to make charging more accessible. Therefore, we are looking for a new team member to join our active sales team as a Sales Development Representative to support us in generating leads and building a solid sales funnel.
 



  





**This is your role** 




 You are part of our active sales team and work actively together with the team to build the funnel. How? You actively reach out to new clients and follow up leads. You learn more about sales and charging stations every day. You always speak up when you come up with amazing new ideas.
 



  





 Your primary responsibilities include finding new business opportunities and set up meetings with potential new clients. By doing so, you find our future customers and become part of our growth journey. And of course, we also provide you with the opportunity to grow within the role and within Elaway.
 



  





**Who are you** 




 We believe that you have at least 1 or 2 years of experience in Sales, particularly experience with sales on phone, and love to sell and meet new people. You see sales opportunities wherever you go and bring the right energy to the table. You are eager to learn and are target-oriented.
 



  





 In terms of languages, you need to be fluent in English and Swedish (verbal and written) – additional languages and cross-cultural experience are a plus. If you have previous experience in CRM systems that would be an extra perk.
 



  





**We love our values - and so should you** 




 A cultural fit is crucial to thrive at Elaway. That's why we need to ensure that you can relate to our values:
 



  





 🚘
 **Drivers first** 
 – O
 *ur customers, the drivers using our chargers, always come first* 




 🎯
 **Focused execution** 
 –
 *We make bold choices, prioritizing what truly matters* 




 and last but not least;
 



 💖
 **Empowered by People** 
 –
 *Together, we are building a better tomorrow* 




  





 If you can relate to these and love them as much as we do, then we might possibly be a perfect match!
 



  





 We truly do hope that we are just what you're looking for, and if so we would love to hear from you.

title: Distribution Account Manager Sweden
description:
**Join Schneider Electric and Make an Impact!**
 At Schneider Electric, we believe that real change starts with us! We provide cutting-edge digital energy and automation solutions to customers around the globe. Our mission is to use energy and resources efficiently, and this can only be achieved through the amazing teamwork and dedication of our employees. Every day, we strive to create a more sustainable future, and we want
 **you** 
 to be part of this journey!
   

  

**Why You Should Apply:**
 We are seeking a
 **Distribution Account Manager** 
 to play a vital role in driving our sales strategy and growing our APC by Schneider Electric. In this position, you will implement growth plans for dedicated accounts, ensuring we meet our sales goals while keeping our customers delighted.
   

  

**What You’ll Do:**
* Build Strong Relationships: Forge deep connections with customers to truly understand their needs.
* Drive Sales Growth: Collaborate with a dynamic team to achieve ambitious sales targets.
* Deliver Exceptional Service: Be a key player in our mission to provide top-notch solutions and service to our clients.


**Your Opportunity to Make a Lasting Impact:**
 Are you ready to elevate your career? Join us in our mission to grow Schneider Electric’s market share and enhance customer satisfaction. This is your chance to be an integral part of a vibrant team!
   

  

 Here’s how you can make a difference:
   

  

* Lead Strategic Initiatives: Work with local and global teams to implement effective sales, project, and service strategies.
* Be the Expert: Dive into account business strategies to drive growth and success.
* Enhance Brand Visibility: Create and execute a quarterly marketing plan that amplifies our presence with distributors.
* Collaborate with Industry Leaders: Manage relationships with key partners like Cisco and Dell, positioning Schneider Electric as an industry leader.
* Optimize Processes: Utilize essential tools for accurate reporting and visibility of achievements.
* Measure Success: Collaborate with analysis and operations teams to drive ROI.
* Travel and Connect: Enjoy the excitement of travel (about 50% of your time) meeting customers in the vibrant Stockholm area.


 This role is more than just a job; it’s your opportunity to be part of something bigger. If you're passionate about making a real impact and driving success, this is the opportunity you’ve been waiting for!
   

  

**Why Schneider Electric?**
 At Schneider Electric, we’re not just offering a job; we’re providing a platform for you to thrive. Here’s what you can look forward to:
   

  

* Work-Life Flexibility: Our Global Flexibility at Work policy allows you to balance your professional and personal life with our hybrid work model.
* Career Growth: Unlock your potential in a supportive environment that encourages learning and development every day.
* Outstanding Benefits: Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including paid family leave and a strong culture of wellness.
* Inclusive Culture: Be part of a workplace that values respect and authenticity. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an environment where everyone feels safe and valued.


 This is your chance to join a company that genuinely cares about your success and well-being. Don’t miss out on this exceptional opportunity!
   

  

**Your Ideal Profile:**
* Educational Background: Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in a relevant technical field.
* Sales Experience: At least 3 years of successful sales experience, showcasing your communication, influencing, and negotiation skills.
* B2B Sales Knowledge: A minimum of 2 years in B2B sales with a solid understanding of the IT distribution landscape.
* Driven to Succeed: Motivated to sell and deliver outstanding results, organized, and persistent in handling complex matters.
* Strong Communicator: Excellent listening skills and the ability to influence others, building strong business networks up to the VP level.
* Tech-Savvy: Experienced in managing customer relationship systems, sales support programs, and social media.
* Language Skills: Fluent in both Swedish and English, written and spoken.
* International Experience: Comfortable working with international contacts and have a valid driver’s license (B).


**Curiosity, Inclusion, Teamwork:**
 At Schneider Electric, we know that every career journey is unique. Your eagerness to learn and grow is what matters most to us. We value your strengths and can’t wait to get to know you!
   

  

**Ready to Take the Next Step?**
 Don’t let this fantastic opportunity slip away! Apply online today by uploading your CV, including your salary expectations, and referencing job ID
 **2024-79308** 
 . Your future at Schneider Electric starts now!
   

  

**Looking to make an IMPACT with your career?**
 When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. We believe that our IMPACT values - Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork - starts with us.
   

  

 IMPACT is also your invitation to join Schneider Electric where you can contribute to turning sustainability ambition into actions, no matter what role you play. It is a call to connect your career with the ambition of achieving a more resilient, efficient, and sustainable world.
   

  

 We are looking for IMPACT Makers; exceptional people who turn sustainability ambitions into actions at the intersection of automation, electrification, and digitization. We celebrate IMPACT Makers and believe everyone has the potential to be one.
   

  

 Become an IMPACT Maker with Schneider Electric - apply today!
   

  

 €36 billion global revenue
   

  

 +13% organic growth
   

  

 150 000+ employees in 100+ countries
   

  

 #1 on the Global 100 World’s most sustainable corporations
   

  

 You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.
   

  

*Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best. We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate, and ‘inclusion’ is one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do. This extends to our Candidates and is embedded in our Hiring Practices.*
*You can find out more about our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion here and our DEI Policy here*
*At Schneider Electric, we uphold the highest standards of ethics and compliance, and we believe that trust is a foundational value. Our Trust Charter is our Code of Conduct and demonstrates our commitment to ethics, safety, sustainability, quality and cybersecurity, underpinning every aspect of our business and our willingness to behave and respond respectfully and in good faith to all our stakeholders. You can find out more about our Trust Charter here*
*Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.*

title: Research Associate- Population Child Health Clinical Research Group, School of Clinical Medicine
Underhållstekniker – Stockholm
description:
Stadler har byggt tåg i över 80 år. Med vår innovationskraft, flexibilitet och tillförlitlighet är vi idag en ledande tillverkare av järnvägsfordon. Cirka 14 000 anställda arbetar på flera produktions- och konstruktionsanläggningar och över 70 serviceställen i Europa, Nordamerika och Nordafrika.
   

  

 I Sverige utför Stadler Service underhåll, reparationer och moderniseringar av järnvägsfordon. Med schweizisk precision strävar vi efter att leverera högsta kvalitet till den svenska järnvägsindustrin. Över 300 medarbetare arbetar i våra välutrustade verkstäder i Tillberga, nära Västerås, Hagalund, Stockholm och Eskilstuna, som utgör basen för Stadler Service Sverige.
   

  

**HUVUDSAKLIGA ARBETSUPPGIFTER** 
 Stadler arbetar med att underhålla och reparera fordon på Roslagsbanan. Vi söker en medarbetare till vår depå på Stockholms Östra. Fordonen är av typen X10p och X15p. För fordonen av typ X10p har vi en spännande resa framför oss, med flertalet projekt kopplade till att uppgradera tekniken och förlänga livslängden. För fordonen av typ X15p arbetas det nu med att driftsätta nya fordon levererade från Stadler fordonstillverkaren och att bedriva underhållet på de redan driftsatta fordonen.
   

  

 Som underhållstekniker på Stadler kommer du att ingå i ett team med följande huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Utföra felsökning, reparation, underhåll och garantiarbeten på järnvägsfordon.
* Boka och avrapportera arbete och materialåtgång i angivet underhållssystem.
* Dokumentation av genomfört arbete utöver vad som ska rapporteras i systemen.
* Avrapportera (klart) fordon till operatör före driftsättning.
* Identifiera förbättringsområden och rapportera dessa vidare, samt aktivt delta i arbetet med ständiga förbättringar.
* Aktivt deltaga i team-möten och forum för säkerhetsarbete.
* Identifiera och rapportera avvikelser på fordon och processer till teamledare.


**ÖNSKVÄRDA KVALIFIKATIONER &
   

  

 PERSONLIGA EGENSKAPER**
* Teknisk eftergymnasial utbildning
* Erfarenhet av arbete med underhåll av järnvägsfordon både mekaniskt och elektriskt
* God IT-kompetens och administrativ förmåga
* Självgående och lösningsorienterad
* Noggrann, strukturerad och drivande
* Säkerhetsmedveten
* God kommunikations- och samarbetsförmåga
* B-körkort
* Tyska är meriterande


 Krav för rollen:
   

  

* Goda kunskaper inom el och mekanik
* Kunna kommunicera på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


**VAD VI ERBJUDER**
 Vi erbjuder en viktig position i en dynamisk miljö med stor möjlighet att forma din roll där du både får lokala samt globala utvecklingsmöjligheter. Hos oss är du med och gör skillnad på vår utvecklingsresa mot en hållbar framtid. Du får jobba i ett expansivt globalt företag som har stort lokalt mandat i den nordiska järnvägsmarknaden och du kommer tillhöra en grupp av individer med olika bakgrund, kompetenser och infallsvinklar. Vi erbjuder konkurrenskraftiga anställningsvillkor och dessutom trevliga kollegor!
   

  

**Har du frågor om den aktuella rollen** 
 Kontakta Peeter Pakker, Produktionschef
   

  

 Mail: Peeter.Pakker@stadlerrail.com

title: Cloud Solution Architect
description:
Antingen är du redan arkitekt eller molnutvecklare med en stark önskan att bli arkitekt? Det viktigast är dock att du är passionerad och brinner för moderna lösningar som utnyttjar molnets alla positiva egenskaper. Vi söker just nu lösningsarkitekter till vårt team i Stockholm.
   

  

**Teamet och inriktningen**
 Teamet fokuserar på att hjälpa våra kunder forma arkitektur och arbetssätt för att nyttja molnet effektivt för att lösa de behov som finns i verksamheten. Det kan handla om övergripande arkitekturprinciper och mer teknisk arkitektur för specifika lösningar. Teamet specialiserar sig också på modern applikationsintegration och kommunikation mellan lösningar, främst med API och event-plattformar. Vi och våra kunder arbetar med alla stora molnplattformar - AWS, GCP och Azure.Kunduppdragen kommer att vara i Stockholm, samtidigt som en global organisation som Capgemini ger dig möjlighet att samarbeta, utvecklas och växa med kollegor och kunder världen över.
   

  

 I teamet specialiserar vi oss för att kunna ge stöd till våra kunders cloud och integrationsbehov i ett anta områden, t.ex:
   

  

* Applikationsdesign och arkitektur i molnmiljöer
* Integrationer för molnbaserade tjänster
* Cloud DevOps och DevSecOps
* Lösningsarkitektur


 Med både bredd och djup erbjuder vi stora möjligheter att bygga vidare på dina arkitekturfärdigheter, dela kunskap och utveckla dig tillsammans med skickliga kollegor i teamet.
   

  

**Din profil**
* Du har tidigare erfarenhet av utveckling av lösningar i public cloud eller molnbaserade containermiljö.
* Du är lösningsarkitekt med erfarenhet inom Azure, AWS eller GCP och kan bevisa det med motsvarande certifiering
* Du har god kommunikations- och presentationsförmåga i kombination med förmåga att leda och vilja att ta ansvar för kundleveranser
* Du skriver och talar flytande svenska då det används i det dagliga arbetet


**Meriterande**
* Back-end erfarenhet inom följande: Python, Node.js, Django och Spring
* Front-end erfarenhet inom följande: Angular, React.js, vue.js och jquery
* DevOps – Till exempel Ansible, Terraform, Jenkins, Kubernetes


  

  

**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas**
 Vi erbjuder dig en dynamisk arbetsmiljö med andra molnspecialister inom Capgemini. Här får du möjligheten att arbeta i projekt med nationella och internationella kunder. Du har friheten att utveckla dig själv med hjälp av Capgeminis egen utbildningsplattform som bl.a. ger dig tillgång till all molnrelaterad utbildning. Berätta om dina ambitioner och vi ser fram emot att hjälpa dig att nå dem.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
* En positiv arbetsmiljö med starkt fokus på innovation och kompetens. Du kommer att arbeta med många av de senaste tekniktrenderna och vara omgiven av duktiga kollegor.
* På Capgemini blir du en del av en global organisation med starkt kundfokus, samarbetskultur och möjlighet till kontinuerligt lärande och utveckling.
* Vårt Cloud & Application Integration-team i Stockholm består av drygt 10 kollegor som arbetar som cloud och integrations-specialister hos våra kunder.
* Capgemini har varit en dominerande aktör inom arkitekturområdet sedan 90-talet, med vårt eget ramverk Integrated Architecture Framework (IAF) och vi bidrar även aktivt till vidareutvecklingen av TOGAF.
* Vi har ett aktivt, globalt arkitektforum med lokala undergrupper där du kan dra nytta av globala och lokala experter inom arkitektur och även bidra med din egen erfarenhet.


**Våra värderingar**
* Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Freedom, Team spirit, Modesty and Fun


**Ansökan**
* Vi rekryterar löpande till denna roll, så skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.


  

  

**Om Capgemini**
 Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda deras övergång till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2023 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,5 miljarder euro.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want |** 
 www.capgemini.com

title: Trainee systemutvecklare Sundbyberg
emails: caroline.tornkvist@skatteverket.se, anna.skytt@skatteverket.se, thomas.cornils@skatteverket.se, tomas.stjernholm@skatteverket.se, jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se
description:
Som trainee hos oss är du med och utvecklar system som bidrar till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vi söker dig som är nyexaminerad och vill utvecklas tillsammans med oss. Vi skapar möjligheter och förutsättningar – resten är upp till dig. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Som trainee inom systemutveckling ingår du i ett av våra agila utvecklingsteam från dag ett. I nära samverkan med verksamheten levererar teamen färdiga lösningar som förenklar för miljontals privatpersoner och företag. Våra system bidrar till ett väl fungerande samhälle genom att skapa förutsättningar för bland annat beskattning, folkbokföring, demokratiska val, brottsbekämpning och internationella samarbeten.
   

  

 Skatteverkets it-traineeprogram är inne på sitt fjärde år och vi planerar nu för nästa start där vi vill anställa upp emot 25 traineer på sju olika orter. Under programmet får du kunskap om Skatteverkets verksamhet och bygger på din erfarenhet. Du har en individuell utvecklingsplan som följs upp och revideras under programperioden så att du kan skapa det bästa upplägget utifrån dina förutsättningar och verksamhetens behov. Du har en erfaren mentor som stöd och bollplank. Traineeprogrammet pågår 12 månader och din vardag består av praktik, utbildning, temadagar och workshops, parallellt med att du jobbar i teamet. Programmets upplägg är noga framtaget för att du ska ha den bästa starten på din karriär. Självklart inleds programmet med en kick-off.
   

  

 Som trainee och systemutvecklare kommer du primärt att utveckla med Red Hat OpenShift (OCP) som målmiljö. För versionshantering används Git och GitHub. För back-end används Java/Spring Boot och för front-end används bl a Angular, React, Vue.js och Node.js. Integrationsområdet utvecklar i en miljö som består av Mulesoft, ActiveMQ, REST- och SOAP-baserade API:er Vissa applikationer körs i RedHat Enterprise Linux (RHEL7) med Oracle produktfamilj, databas, applikationsserver och processmotor. För Devops ingår du i systemteamet där du får använda din problemlösningsförmåga till att skapa förutsättningar för system som underlättar vardagen för många.
   

  

 På vår stora it-avdelning med nära 1500 kollegor har du möjlighet att utvecklas samtidigt som du bidrar till samhällsnyttan. Du har flexibel arbetstid och det är en självklarhet för oss att du ska ha en balans mellan arbete och fritid.
   

  

 För denna tjänst kommer du vara placerad i Sundbyberg.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* vara en teamspelare och se till både gruppens och din egen prestation
* kunna analysera informationsflöden, se samband, mönster och göra avgränsningar
* ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker och att kunna tänka om när det behövs
* vara nyfiken, gilla utmaningar och ha förmågan att driva din egen och verksamhetens utveckling framåt
* uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska och kommunicera på ett engagerande sätt.


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* en pågående eller nyligen avslutad utbildning som civilingenjör, högskoleingenjör eller med inriktning systemvetenskap/ datavetenskap (minst 180 hp) från högskola eller universitet med examen från år 2023 eller framåt, dock senast augusti 2025
* erfarenhet av systemutveckling från studietiden.


 Det är önskvärt att du har erfarenhet av test i backend och/eller frontend system från studietiden
 **.**
**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och inleds med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/526 | Kontakt: Caroline Törnkvist (HR-specialist rekrytering) caroline.tornkvist@skatteverket.se, Anna Skytt (rekryterande chef) anna.skytt@skatteverket.se, Thomas Cornils (rekryterande chef) thomas.cornils@skatteverket.se, Tomas Stjernholm (rekryterande chef) tomas.stjernholm@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2024-12-16 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-01-31

title: Senior Data Platform Engineer
description:
**Senior Data Platform Engineer – Data Infrastructure Team**




**Stockholm,**




**English Speaking**




**Salary up to 70,000 SEK/month**




***Relocation Support for EU-based candidates (flight and baggage covered)***




  





 Our client is looking for a Senior Data Platform Engineer to join their Data Infrastructure team, which is a core component of their Data Platform division. In this role, you’ll play an essential part in building a mature, scalable data ecosystem to support business growth and actionable insights.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 As a Senior Data Platform Engineer, you’ll collaborate with a diverse and skilled team to evolve the data platform, focusing on data ingestion, processing, and management. The infrastructure runs primarily on Google Cloud, with tools such as Airflow for pipeline orchestration, BigQuery as a data warehouse, and Kubernetes for scalable infrastructure. This hybrid role requires three days per week in their Stockholm office.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Work with data engineers, analysts, and stakeholders to design and improve the data platform, enabling reliable data collection, processing, access, and monitoring.
* Develop architectural guidelines, best practices, and solutions for data pipelines, primarily using Airflow/Composer.
* Manage Google Cloud resources via Infrastructure-as-Code tools, such as Terraform.
* Integrate new and existing data sources into ELT and reverse ETL pipelines.
* Address data governance, cataloging, discovery, and access requirements with strategic technical solutions.
* Implement standardized monitoring, CI/CD, and testing practices to ensure data quality and reliability.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to capture data requirements and build solutions to meet their needs.
* Continuously evaluate and adopt new technologies to enhance the data infrastructure.



  





**Requirements** 



* **Infrastructure expertise** 
 : Strong experience with cloud infrastructure (
 **GCP preferred** 
 ).
* **Data orchestration and automation** 
 : Proficient in tools like Airflow or Pub/Sub and Terraform for IaC.
* **Data environment improvement** 
 : Proven experience scaling immature data platforms to robust, high-functioning environments.
* **Flexible experience** 
 : Minimum three years of relevant experience if accompanied by hands-on scale-up experience.



  





**Ideal Qualifications** 



* 4–5 years of experience in data infrastructure, systems architecture, and GCP-related technologies.
* Proficiency in ingestion frameworks, orchestration tools, and data security/compliance (GDPR, PII).
* Expertise in distributed systems, cloud infrastructure, and data pipelines.
* Strong knowledge of software engineering practices, including version control, CI/CD, and documentation.
* Proficiency in Python.
* Excellent communication skills for bridging technical and non-technical discussions.



  





 Our client seeks someone passionate about data infrastructure and ready to take on a high-impact role. This opportunity could be a great fit if you are skilled in data engineering with a strong focus on infrastructure and scalability!

title: Kommunikatör
description:
Har du ett brinnande intresse för webb och sociala medier, gillar att koordinera projekt och vill arbeta i en miljö där ingen dag är den andra lik? Då kan du vara vår nya kommunikatör på WCAG Networks!

**Om rollen**

Som kommunikatör hos oss får du ett varierat arbete där du stöttar vår VD och samordnar många av våra löpande projekt. Rollen innebär alltifrån att hantera mejl och följa upp leveranser till att skriva och publicera inlägg för våra sociala medier. Du kommer även att hjälpa till med enklare uppdateringar av våra webbplatser.

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter**

* Skapa och redigera text, bild och film för olika kanaler
* Skapa, skriva och publicera innehåll för sociala medier (Instagram, LinkedIn)
* Hantera inkommande e-post och koordinera uppdrag
* Följa upp leveranser
* Testa nya funktioner på våra olika webbplatser
* Stötta med administrativa samt privata uppgifter

**Vem är du?**

Vi söker dig som är strukturerad, lösningsorienterad och som gillar att ha koll på detaljer. Du trivs med att planera och organisera, men är också kreativ när det gäller att skapa innehåll som engagerar. Då rollen innefattar mycket självständigt arbete ser vi gärna att du tar eget ansvar och vågar fatta beslut.

**Vi tror att du:**

* Har viss erfarenhet av (eller stort intresse för) arbete med webbsidor och appar
* Gillar att skriva och skapa innehåll för digitala kanaler
* Trivs med att koordinera och planera projekt/uppgifter
* Har en förmåga att arbeta strukturerat och självständigt
* Är bekväm med att resa utomlands ibland

Meriterande kunskaper

* Adobe Creative Cloud (t.ex. Photoshop, InDesign, Premiere Pro)
* Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
* Erfarenhet av foto och film (produktion eller redigering)
* Tidigare skribent- eller redaktörserfarenhet

**Varför WCAG Networks?**

Hos oss blir du del av ett engagerat team som brinner för att göra webben mer tillgänglig och användarvänlig för alla. Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö med goda möjligheter till både kreativ och personlig utveckling. Som kommunikatör får du en central roll i hur vi kommunicerar och utvecklar vår närvaro digitalt.

**Ansökan**

Låter det här som något för dig? Ansök gärna direkt via Indeed eller skicka din ansökan till kontakt@wcagnetworks.com. Vi går igenom ansökningarna löpande och ser fram emot att höra från dig!

Välkommen till WCAG Networks – tillsammans gör vi webben enklare och mer inkluderande!

Jobbtyp: Heltid, Tillsvidare

Förmåner:

* Extra semesterdagar
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Jobba hemifrån
* Tjänstepension

Ansökningsfrågor:

* Bor du i Stockholm med omnejd?

Utbildning:

* Högskoleexamen (Obligatoriskt)

Erfarenhet:

* Kommunikation: 1 år (Obligatoriskt)

Språk:

* Svenska (Obligatoriskt)
* Engelska (Obligatoriskt)

Arbetsort: Delvis på distans i 114 56 Stockholm

title: Engineer- Security
description:
**Job Description:**


Mars is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Cybersecurity Incident Response Analyst to join our team. As the EU Lead for our Incident Response (IR) team, you will play a critical role in protecting our organization from cyber threats and ensuring business continuity. You will be responsible for leading and executing incident response activities within the European region, collaborating with global teams, and providing expert guidance on cybersecurity best practices.

**What are we looking for?**
============================

**Essential Requirements:**

* 3+ years of experience in cybersecurity incident response or a Security Operations Center (SOC), including hands-on experience with incident triage, investigation, containment, eradication, and recovery. This should include experience with detection and response tools (EDR, XDR, NDR).
* Strong understanding of common attack vectors (e.g., malware, phishing, ransomware, social engineering) and the MITRE ATT&CK Framework.
* Proven ability to analyze security logs, network traffic, and other relevant data sources to identify and investigate security incidents. Experience with security information and event management (SIEM) systems.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Demonstrated ability to work effectively as part of a cyber security team, collaborating with colleagues to address security challenges and ensure cohesive, coordinated efforts during investigations and resolutions

**Nice-to-haves:**

* Hands-on experience with cloud security tools and services (e.g., CloudTrail, CloudWatch, Security Center, IAM). Experience with container security and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
* Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, PowerShell).
* Knowledge of relevant cybersecurity frameworks and standards (e.g., NIST Cybersecurity Framework, ISO 27001).
* Industry certifications such as AWS Certified Security - Specialty, Azure Security Engineer Associate, CISSP, CISA, etc.

**What will be your key responsibilities?**
===========================================

* Lead and execute incident response activities within the EU region, including triage, investigation, containment, eradication, and recovery. Collaborate with global IR team members and stakeholders to ensure consistent and effective incident response across the organization.
* Monitor Cybersecurity Threat Intelligence (CTI) platforms to stay abreast of the latest cybersecurity threats and vulnerabilities and adapt incident response strategies accordingly. Develop CTI briefs regarding critical vulnerabilities for dissemination across the organization.
* Develop and maintain incident response plans and playbooks, as tools, technology, and the organization change.
* Provide security awareness training and guidance to employees within the EU region.

**What can you expect from Mars?**
==================================

* Work with diverse and talented Associates, all guided by the Five Principles.
* Join a purpose driven company, where we’re striving to build the world we want tomorrow, today.
* Best-in-class learning and development support from day one, including access to our in-house Mars University.
* An industry competitive salary and benefits package, including company bonus.


Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.
company_description: Mars is home to some of the best-known brands in the world in confectionary, family meals, petcare, veterinarian services and much more.

title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Luton, GBR Hannover, DE; Stockholm -Arlanda, SE; Rijswijk, NL; Zaventem, BE; Hybrid Permanent Full Time 37.5 131166
As a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, you will define business and technical requirements and have a hands-on role in the development lifecycle, working across TUI Group source markets. We are looking for experienced, business intelligence professionals to become part of our ambitious team as we embark on an exciting transformation developing a single data platform. You will be working with the latest technology, with access to ongoing learning and opportunities for self-development, whilst establishing yourself in our global network of experts.


Investment in data and analytics is critical to TUI’s future strategy to enable to us to respond to customer needs and optimize our sales across multiple markets. To support this, we are developing a new data platform to capture raw data from all source markets to integrate into a cloud-based data lake and commercial data warehouse. Based on initial success we are looking to further accelerate the investment and so are looking for talented and curious individuals to join the team. We will capture and integrate data from sourcing, inventory, profitability and booking systems and other external data. This will be used to create reports, dashboards, analytical models and provide input to advanced yield management techniques including artificial intelligence and machine learning. As part of its customer driven strategy, TUI is continually developing and adapting its product portfolio and methods of distribution and are seeking to continually improve both the speed and accuracy of decision making through analytics.


This is a fantastic opportunity to join us as we embark on this exciting journey to work across TUI Group source markets to determine data availability, reporting requirements, define development work required and ensure that they are built, tested and supported.

 **Please note the closing date for applications is: Sunday 19th January**

 **ABOUT THE ROLE**

* Data requirements: You'll be working with business users to understand business and data requirements and ensure that these are properly understood and documented. Using various methods and tools you will review detailed reporting requirements and develop and document use cases for the relevant business areas
* Reporting requirements: Working with end-users across various business functions you'll be evaluating and shaping the best reporting solution. You will understand the business problems and document reporting or dashboard requirements. You will need to fully understand not just what report is required, but what business problem they are trying to solve and using your in-depth knowledge of the business and data sources.
* Report building: Building, deploying and maintaining reports you'll ensure these are accurate, effective, understood by the business users and are in line with company development and design standards.
* Data sourcing: You'll carry out detailed analysis of multiple source data sets. You will need to fully understand data structures and attributes and be familiar with high level underlying business processes used to populate the source systems.
* Definition: We will look to you to produce detailed technical requirements including data modelling, source to target mapping, data transformations, data conformation, data mapping and non-functional requirements. These will need to be documented and user stories created for data engineering to work from for development.
* Development lifecycle: You will work closely with the data engineering team during the development phase, answering any questions required and clarifying any data issues raised. You will also be working directly on data transformations using SQL. You will be responsible for the first pass of user acceptance testing and will ensure that the relevant business users carry out UAT before go-live.
* Data support: You'll provide support for data issues and ensure that any resolutions required are documented and added to the development backlog. As the subject matter expert, you will provide data understanding support in the team and help with advanced queries where required

**ABOUT YOU**

* Proven high level of technical expertise in BI environments including modern database design and principals with advanced understanding and practical experience of SQL and strong Tableau experience
* Experience of working with stakeholders and other developers within a BI reporting environment to understand and define user requirements for reporting and visualisations
* Extensive experience in developing and managing dashboards and reports in Tableau
* Extensive practical experience of business and technical analysis for large scale data warehouse projects.
* Extensive experience of engaging with technical and non-technical users to gather, understand and document business requirements, produce appropriate reports and visualisations
* Advanced SQL skills with broad experience and understanding of data warehouse models and principles
* Hands on experience with Tableau (data source creation, dashboard creation, report authoring and troubleshooting, data source management)
* Experience of managing the expectations of internal clients and stakeholders whilst supporting reporting users to best make use of the technology and the data opportunities that exist to support their departmental initiatives
* Excellent communication, interpersonal and relationship skills


From a workplace to a place to belong. At TUI we embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion, encouraging everyone to come as you are, because together, our potential is limitless.  

  

We are committed to supporting candidates with disabilities and impairments so if you require any support, please do let us know.

title: Service Desk Specialist, Tietoevry Banking (m/f/d)
description:
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.
Service Desk Specialist – Tietoevry Banking (m/f/d)
We are looking for a Service Desk Specialist who wants to be part of Tietoevry Banking. Tietoevry Banking is the leading financial services software and solution partner in the Nordics. We offer modular, pre-integrated banking as a service solutions and market-leading software for core, payments, credit, cards, financial fraud, and wealth. With our scale, expertise, and specialization, we empower financial institutions to enhance agility, efficiency, and accelerate digital transformation.  

You will join our Service and Support team which are responsible for delivering top edge services to our customers running our software solutions as SaaS solutions and on-premises solutions. Our teams are in Stockholm, Skövde, Kalix and Belgrade and cooperates with colleagues in other locations as well.
As a Service Desk Specialist you will be working in our 1st line team as our prime communication channel between our customer and the rest of our own organization. Your role involves investigating incidents, communicating with customers and internal resources, and ensuring high customer satisfaction. You will also contribute to improving our services and processes to enhance quality and efficiency.
Job Responsibilities:* Follow our ITIL processes to ensure smooth operations.
* Monitor and manage tickets using the ITSM tool, ServiceNow.
* Take part in customer meetings, lead them when needed, and prepare presentations and monthly reports.
* Escalate unresolved tickets to the 2nd line support team.
* Work with the 2nd line team, IT Operations team, and customers on daily tickets, notifications, reports and change requests.
* Communicate openly with customers, ensuring their satisfaction, handling requests and complaints, and providing support.
* Make sure we meet all our service delivery commitments.
* Understand contract terms, plan support resources, monitor performance, and ensure deadlines and deliverables are met.


Who We Are Looking For:* Excellent Communication Skills: You have strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Language Proficiency: You are fluent in English, both spoken and written. Fluency in Swedish or any other Scandinavian language is a plus.
* Customer Service Experience: You have experience in customer service.
* Team Player and Independent Worker: You enjoy working as part of a team but can also work independently.
* Customer Satisfaction Focus: You are passionate about delivering high-quality service and building relationships. You have a mature mindset and the confidence to make and enforce well-founded decisions according to agreed service levels.
* ITSM Tools Experience: Previous experience with ITSM tools (like ServiceNow) is beneficial but not mandatory.
* ITIL Understanding: Familiarity with ITIL processes is a plus but not required.
* Knowledge Sharing: You are good at sharing knowledge and comfortable with holding training sessions.
* Flexibility to work in shifts: weekends and night shifts excluded.


As a person, we believe you are a team player who takes action and demonstrates responsibility to organize your work and solve your tasks. With our agile end-to-end development process, you will continue to both learn from, and spread knowledge to your colleagues, so communication is important for us. Technology is developing fast, so learning new cutting-edge technologies is something you strive to do.
We offer
We offer you professional growth, meaningful projects, open culture and an outstanding work-life balance! We offer you an opportunity to create the future of a growing, fast-developing and important sector. We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working. Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle where you need to unlearn and relearn every day as new possibilities emerge.
Did we get you inspired?
We look forward to your application!
Interviews will be held continuously, so we encourage you to apply today! For more information or questions, please contact Talent Acquisition team recruitmentinbanking@tietoevry.com
Hope to hear from you soon!
Location: Kalix, Sweden*On specific positions we might perform background checks.**Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.*
About Tietoevry
Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs. Familiar yourself with what we do
Creating purposeful technology to reinvent the world for good
At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Business Development Representative (BDR) - Sweden
description:
Our Company
  
  

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.
  
  

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!
  
  

The opportunity
  
From the moment you wake up in the morning, until you go to bed at night, consider the media you consume, the adverts you see, the apps you use, the websites you browse, and almost all of the shopping you do online throughout the day. Chances are that every single one of those interactions or experiences was touched by an Adobe product.
  
We have a phenomenal opportunity for a Business Development Representative (BDR) to join our Digital Experience teams in Stockholm, Sweden!
  
What you’ll do
  
As Business Development Representatives (BDR), you are responsible for helping your prospects re-imagine their customer experiences using Adobe solutions & in the process crafting new sales opportunities for your Account Executives (AEs).
  
You will anticipate and adapt to customers’ constantly evolving expectations with Adobe Experience Cloud.
  
Drive force for identifying and providing high-value opportunities into the Sales pipeline and the first line of relationship development with prospective high-value accounts.
  
Deliver a “consultative” approach to selling; taking time to understand the prospect’s business, their goals, objectives, and challenges before recommending a solution.
  
Consistently achieve quality pipeline & other metrics such as Inbound lead follow-up & outbound account engagement metrics.
  
Handle territory creation plan for your key account executives & their accounts.
  
Researching key accounts, identifying decision-makers, generating interest, and developing accounts to stimulate need.
  
Prospect, educate, qualify, and develop Target Accounts and inbound leads to build sales-ready leads and opportunities.
  
Quickly route prospects and current customers to appropriate colleagues to assist in solving problems and driving value. Nurtures & provides education on areas of interest for under-informed customers.
  
Setup, attend & run 1st level qualification meetings with customers prior to passing it on to relevant Account Executive & Solution Consultants.
  
Work collaboratively with Sales & Solution Consultant teams to further qualify and generate pipeline.
  
Updating CRM, Outreach, and other tools to ensure logging of key history & ensuring a smooth hand-off to the Account Executive.
  
Collaborate closely with the Marketing team to run and assist in performing lead generation campaigns and follow-up on leads.
  
Run outbound campaigns to ensure a balanced pipeline built across territories.
  
Providing closed-loop feedback to BDR organization to ensure continuous process optimization.
  
  

What you'll need to succeed
  
1+ years’ experience in Sales/Business Development in a SaaS context, ideally engaging with enterprise clients.
  
Confirmed sales skills delivering inbound & outbound experiences and building positive relationships at multiple levels within an organization.
  
Experience running all areas of the BDR process including account planning, pre-call preparation, opportunity qualification, and objection handling.
  
Self-starter with high motivation, independence, resilience, and ability to collaborate with sales & marketing teams.
  
Ability to quickly learn & understand sophisticated business problems & translate customers' needs into solution plays.
  
Proficient with standard corporate efficiency tools (email, voicemail, MS Office) and experience with sales tools such as Microsoft Dynamics, SFDC, Outreach, ZoomInfo, Lusha, etc.
  
Phenomenal teammate with ability to work well with multiple partners across sales, marketing & solution teams.
  
Full fluency in both Swedish and English are a must. Additional Nordic languages are a plus.
  
  

The BDR role opens up many doors within the broader Adobe ecosystem. There are opportunities to advance into sales, customer success, marketing, and many more.
  
  

As our many awards will tell you, at Adobe you’ll be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized around the world. You’ll be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our outstanding Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog, Adobe Life and explore the extraordinary benefits we offer at Rewards.adobe.com.
  
Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We hire dedicated individuals, regardless of gender, race or colour, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We know that when our employees feel appreciated and included, they can be more creative, innovative and successful. This is what it means to be Adobe For All.
  
We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are dedicated to crafting exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new insights can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!
  
  

Adobe is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based on gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law. Learn more.
  
  

Adobe aims to make Adobe.com accessible to any and all users. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to navigate our website or complete the application process, email accommodations@adobe.com or call (408) 536-3015.
  
  

Adobe values a free and open marketplace for all employees and has policies in place to ensure that we do not enter into illegal agreements with other companies to not recruit or hire each other’s employees.

title: Senior Director Sales
description:
**Company Description**  

It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.

 **Job Description** **What you get to do in this role:**

* Lead direct Sales Executives to drive rapid new business sales growth in the region
* Drive sales strategy for the region in alignment with the plan and in coordination with Sales Operations to effectively Go-To-Market including understanding the competitive landscape, presence and strength within the region
* Actively engage in territory planning, relationship development and opportunity development and driving revenue by supporting and assisting Field Sales Teams in closing opportunities
* Recruit, coach and mentor team members to drive excellence
* Development of territories and quota for the sales team and effectively communicate to set performance expectations within the team
* Manage and report accurate forecast and pipeline to the business
* Achievement of annual sales goals on a quarterly and annual basis is required
* Engage and align effectively in C-level meetings in order to properly understand customer business requirements
* Build effective working relationships with Solution Consulting, Business Units, Professional Services, Marketing, our Partner community and the ServiceNow executive team
* Manage indirectly our Digital Sales Team, including Sales Development and Inside Sales teams.
* Retain and grow existing customer base with regular non-sales customer engagement activities to deliver an excellent customer experience
* Demonstrate operational cadence to drive the Commercial team to be the engine for new logo and new business.
* Advocate and drive early in careers team, helping develop and progress our talent through our extended Commercial Organisation.
* Collaborate with the broader, regional Senior Leadership team to drive culture and sales success – contribute to strategy, planning and business decisions.

  

**Qualifications** **To be successful in this role you have:**

* Extensive track record of new business sales success including presentation and negotiation skills within industry and at C Level
* Strong success in recruiting, coaching and managing an exceptional sales team
* Strong strategic thinking including analytical and financial planning skills to meet and exceed quotas and goals.
* Ownership of accurate CRM reports including current and future quarterly forecasts and opportunity inspection
* Experienced in driving sales process and drive effective working relationships with Sales Operations
* Ability to understand the 'bigger picture' and business drivers around IT
* Ability to build long term strategic and senior level relationships
* Ability to adapt and work effectively within a rapidly changing and growing environment
* Demonstrates strong business and financial acumen
* Built self-motivated sales teams that embrace a culture of collaboration, enthusiasm, and overachievement
* Champions and promotes top performers, constantly develops and coaches the team and themselves, and top grades appropriately
* Proven partner relationships and networks, and ability to grow the impact of revenue streams and territory development through the partner ecosystem
* Ownership of driving successful pipeline generation activities developed by marketing or the partner community

*Not sure if you meet every qualification? We still encourage you to apply! We value inclusivity, welcoming candidates from diverse backgrounds, including non-traditional paths. Unique experiences enrich our team, and the willingness to dream big makes you an exceptional candidate!*

 **Additional Information** **Work Personas**


We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work. Learn more here.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
